German Whist Hello world! Settings Help How to Play The deck (no jokers) is divided into 4 piles of 13 cards. Each player receives one pile as their hand: of the remaining two, one is placed face-up and the other face-down. 

The suit of the card on top of the face-up pile is trumps for that game. A "trick" consists of both players playing a card. First to play in the trick can play any card they wish. Second to play must "follow suit" if possible - ie, play a card of the same suit. 

Whoever plays the card with the higher value wins - ace is high, 2 is low. 

If the second player can't follow suit, they lose unless they play a trumps (in which case, they win.) While the face-up and face-down piles have cards, the winner of the trick draws a card from the face-up pile, and the loser draws a card from the face-down pile. The winner of the trick plays first in the next trick. 

Hence, the first 13 tricks consist of "hand-building": you want to win or lose the trick depending on the currently face-up card. 

When there are no cards left to draw, winning a trick awards you a point. The winner is the player who has the most points at the end of the game, when both players have no cards remaining. Statistics New Game resetStats suitOrder> ♦♣♥♠
